data.title: Cautionary tale of wonderkid to lame duck
data.meta_description: Alexandre Pato was cowering with others in the corner of a barricaded side-room at Corinthians’ training ground as 100 angry supporters, some wielding steel bars, stormed the club’s base after
data.text:
Alexandre Pato was cowering with others in the corner of a barricaded side-room at Corinthians’ training ground as 100 angry supporters, some wielding steel bars, stormed the club’s base after tearing through its wire mesh perimeter fence.

They had come in force to protest about the team’s poor form and, specifically, Pato, their misfit striker.

Yet with Corinthians’ record £12 million signing safely holed up, it was his unfortunate strike partner who bore the brunt, Paolo Guerrero being grabbed around the neck as the violence threatened to turn even nastier.

That was five months ago. Today, Brazil will face Chile in their round-of-16 tie in Belo Horizonte, with Neymar again carrying the expectations of a nation. Just ahead of him, the rather unrefined figure of
